author: Greg Bell
title: Migrate Ethereum

assessments.note: Cardano core developments already create the ingredients necessary for this to happen. It's unclear how the solution posed by the challenge, Cardano is doing this in all of its scheduled deployments. At that end why Ethereum and not all the others cryptocurrencies, Cardano could be a store of value, passive income, Dapps/Defi platforms and much more. Bitcoin seams to be getting the biggest fish which are the ones capable of changing at a faster rate the Cardano vision. Etherium is a pawn in the bigger scale of things.
Good ideas but should also be focusing on new projects rather than copying Ethereum's

There are a lot of projects on the Ethereum blockchain which rely on a high amount of transactions that have stalled due to high gas fees.
The Cardano blockchain offers the possibility to execute these projects faster and cheaper, providing an opportunity to continue these projects.

Project Catalyst would benefit from this because it would mean an influx of both projects and project developers, which are already engaged and might have an already finished product, scaling up the capacity.
Migrating Ethereum projects is critical to Cardano's success, however it doesn't imply that this particular challenge represents that need.
Given the number of existing Ethereum projects, enticing these into moving to Cardano would be very beneficial

I am in conflict here. Even though I fully support the idea, I see that this is estimated for USD 400.000, the entire funding for this campaign. This is very problematic. I can therefore neither go for a full Yes nor for a clear No. There are also other excellent topics competing for this money-what a pity.

Here is the framework for how I estimate the level of IMPACT for the new Challenge for Fund6:
1) Is this a wicked problem that has not been addressed in previous challenges?

While IOG is clearly focusing on creating a bridge to Cardano from Ethereum with their ERC-20 converter and K-EVM, and side chains. There are almost certainly many, many more ways that we the Cardano ecosystem could benefit from additional bridges and interoperability with Ethereum. A huge amount of the expertise in Blockchain is working in the Ethereum ecosystem. So bridges and collaborations between chains would be beneficial to both.
2) Is this addressing a "green pasture" opportunity that could improve the well-being across a major region or globally?

At this point in time I would also say that there are only a few truly compelling use cases in the Ethereum ecosystem. It is true that it is a new financial system, but to date it is mainly a speculative one for trading money and focusing on short term gains. The real value is in delivering high fidelity systems that translate well across the world and bring in people and resources that are currently ignored, devalued or inaccessible to the current financial system. Right now Ethereum is mainly useful as a new form of trading for fintech bros, macro wonks and gold bugs. So the main benefit would be by attracting developers. Useful, but as in the island, pond and ocean analogy there probably is actually a lot more talent and expertise elsewhere.

3) How much will the requested funds catalyze this effort and produce a meaningful result over the next few years?

The amount of funds requested are the entire community challenge amount. This should be significant enough to really foster interest, buzz and community support around the effort. I personally don't like that the whole fund is being requested, but to stay faithful to my assessment it actually would be a huge statement about how serious Cardano is to bridging to Ethereum.

many projects are just waiting for the release of smartcontract on the adablockchain to migrate. Most of the work is already done but IOHK, you should e-mail them to see what they are currently doing.
This project looks promising. However, I would need more information on how you plan to move projects from Ethereum to Cardano.

Cardano community definitely has both capacity, capability, technology and community to address this challenge and I think by default it already has had the solution being developed in placed for it to happen overtime.

The feasibility of this proposal relies on the marketing capacity of the proposed project.
You will need a team to both go out and contact projects on the Ethereum blockchain and advertise that we are here and potentially reach out a helping hand for those in need.
Use the tags to attract marketing professionals to perform this task.

I'd like to address that the Cardano blockchain has a function to bridge over the code from Ethereum Solidity to Cardano using Apple's IELE-protocol. Meaning Ethereum Solidity code works as is on the Cardano blockchain.
cardano community should focus is energy in areas that help those committed to onboarding to Cardano you can lead a horse to water but you can not make it drink!

This is more dependent on the authors of projects being migrated than on Cardano community. Actually, we may only provide a migration monitoring site and kindly ask the owners to report their transfer there.
We would really need to "lobby" with the Etherum community and to "win" them over so it's a bit beyond just relying on the existing Catalyst community
Yes, I definitely think that our community has the capacity and expertise to address this challenge setting.

My framework for this assessment for how suitable this challenge is as follows:
1) Product-market fit: is this a wicked problem that is has a lot of demand, is uniquely suited to Cardano or if done successfully will really set Cardano apart?

This has great product-market fit. Very similar to porting IOS games over to Android. With the tools that IOG is providing to help bridge the gap, there is already a foundation to build on and probably a lot of benefit to providing people an easy way to try out the Cardano blockchain for work they have already done in Ethereum.

2) Circle of competence: is there enough competence and passion in the ecosystem so proposals will have great leadership and synergy between team, partners and/or community?

This one is hard to assess. Right now, the blockchain community is very tribal and dominated by maximalism. I think this is changing, but it is very possible that the Ethereum community has a lot of entrenched loyalists so could be hard to establish bridges. That said, there is also a tremendous amount of entrepreneurial energy in blockchain which means people will want to roll with the latest and greatest tech (which Cardano is, right!?). So creating support and focus on inviting those entrepeneurs to bridge to Cardano could have a very large upside.

3) Accelerators: Are there clear network effects or other advantages that will drive success?

Yes. Ethereum is the largest blockchain, smart contract development ecosystem right now. Success in creating ethereum bridges and collabs would probably have a large positive ripple effect
As before, look at what the team is already doing. The idea is sound and nice, but they are already doing it and have actively thought how and why doing it.
It would be great if there was a roadmap detailing plans on how to move projects from Ethereum to Cardano. Besides, I believe this will be dependent on the project owners.

There are no clear defined success criteria and suggested metrics on how to achieve the proposal in question, although is more of analyzing the numbers of Developers and identifying a number of tools, instruments and markets used and deployed by these developers to better inform the community as to what to accommodate a transition, there's no clear outline as to how the proponent would carry this out and how it would achieve these, how the information is deployed and to whom.

I like that there is already a rudimentary roadmap with milestones in place in the potential directions.

I do have a question about the asked budget. Basically, what is asked for is 400000 USD (or even 500000 USD) for a wide scale marketing campaign. Which is too much in my opinion.
 It would be good to see this worked out in further detail as to what portion of the budget would be used for each aspect, so there can be formed a clear picture of the funding.

Success criteria are unclear. "Talking regularly" is not quantifiable measure. The Key Metrics proposed are better but may include only those migrations that have been submitted to the monitoring system.
Metric are relevant, but would probably set more concrete goals e.g. 10 projects migrated to Cardano, and also measure the number of users those migration would bring
The author spent some time to think about this and provided some good ideas concerning success metrics. More thoughts needed.

My framework for how measurable this challenge is as follows:
1) Is the wicked problem described with clear intent so that the community is inspired and challenged to bring their best ideas?

Yes. Clear concise, and very challenging! Cross-platform work is difficult.
2) Are there clear goals and metrics that guide proposals towards meaningful results?


Yes, the challenge focuses on the actual migrations that happen as a result. This is a great metric that drives towards the ultimate desired outcome.
3) Are the requested treasury funds well matched to support multiple game-changing proposals within the scope of the challenge?

This is my one disagreement with this proposal. I think asking for the entire fund puts this whole challenge at risk because it pushes out any other possibilities. Everything else about this challenge is high value, but might not get the support it needs because it takes all the community funds.
The 4 metrics are good but you should add more metrics specially if you want to keep finer track record.
What would be great is seeing the project come to life but with a much more broken down budget. It still needs work and still needs to be fleshed out a bit more.

importance: Ethereum has major projects and problems. Migration to Cardano would be good for the projects and Cardano. Ethereum 2.0 has a long way to go
success: The Ethereum community and crypto media are talking regularly about projects that are moving or have moved successfully to Cardano.
